section.title: Intentions and wishes
section.sectiontitle: We use subject + be + going to + verb to talk about an intention in the near or more distant future.
section.text1a: I'm going to be a famous actor.
section.text2a: She's going to look for a new job.
section.sectiontitle2: We normally use planning to + verb when we have thought carefully about the plan and decided how to do it.
section.text3a: They're planning to speak at the meeting.
section.text4a: He's planning to leave this company next year.

section.title: Intentions and wishes
section.sectiontitle: In the negative, we use subject + be + not + going/planning to + verb. We usually use the short form, either we aren't or we're not ... .
section.text1: I'm going to see James today.
section.text1a: I'm not going to see James today.
section.text2: We're planning to buy a car.
section.text2a: We're not planning to buy a car.
section.sectiontitle2: In the question, we use be + subject + going/planning to + verb.
section.text3a: Is she going to sing? Yes, she is.
section.text4a: Are you planning to stay here? No, I'm not.

section.title: Intentions and wishes
section.sectiontitle: We use would like to + verb to say what we want to do. It's more polite than want to. We usually use the short form.
section.text1a: I'd like to travel around the world one day.
section.text2a: I'd like to see the manager, please.
section.sectiontitle2: We use would rather + verb to say we prefer one thing to another thing. We usually use the short form.
section.text3: Do you want to go to the party or stay at home?
section.text4: Do you want to drive or go by taxi?

section.title: Intentions and wishes
section.sectiontitle: In the questions, we use Would + subject + like to/rather + verb.
section.text1a: Would she like to come to the cinema? Yes, she would.
section.text2a: Would you rather sit or stand? I'd rather stand.
section.sectiontitle2: We use subject + would rather + not + verb to make the negative. We don't often use would like to in the negative.
section.text3: I'd rather speak to Sam today.
section.text3a: I'd rather not speak to Sam today.
